alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 10:27AM MDT until March 31 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER RETURNS TO THE TUSAS AND SANGRE DE CRISTO MOUNTAINS TODAY AND RATON PASS TONIGHT, LASTING THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .A Pacific storm system will push through New Mexico today, bringing with it colder temperatures and accumulating snow to much of northern New Mexico. The highest accumulations are favored in the Tusas Mountains including Chama and the Sangre de Cristo Mountains today through Wednesday. Accumulating and blowing snow reach Raton Pass tonight through Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Midnight MDT Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
